name: 張文中
objective:
To acquire mathematical tools for analyzing linear systems:
Mathematical Descriptions of Systems, Background Linear Algebra, State-Space Solutions and Realizations, Stability, Controllability and Observability, Minimal Realizations and Coprime Fractions, State Feedback and State Estimators, Pole Placement
schedule:
Week     Topic
1.(9/15) Introduction
2.(9/22) Background linear algebra
3.(9/29) Mathematical descriptions of systems
4.(10/6) Linearization
5.(10/13) State-space solutions
6.(10/20) Realizations
7.(10/27) Presentations (I)
8.(11/3) Stability of LTI systems
9.(11/10) Lyapunov theorem
10.(11/17) Controllability
11.(11/24) Observability
12.(12/1) Coprime fractions
13.(12/8) Presentations (II)
14.(12/15) Minimal realizations
15.(12/22) State feedback
16.(12/29) State estimators
17.(1/5) Pole placement
18.(1/12) Final exam
scorePolicy: The final grade will be a weighted average of homework+quizzes 25%, Presentation+Report 35%, and final 40%.
materials: Linear System Theory and Design - Fourth Edition, Chi-Tsong Chen, Oxford University Press, 2012
